newsitem.title: PERU: Car-bomb explodes in poor Lima suburb - radio.
newsitem.headline: Car-bomb explodes in poor Lima suburb - radio.

text.p: A car-bomb exploded early Thursday in a poor suburb of the Peruvian capital Lima, causing some light injuries and damage, local radio station Radio Cadena de Noticias reported.
Anti-explosives police said they were going to the scene of the detonation in the Ate Vitarte district.
Both of Peru's two main guerrilla movements, the Tupac Amaru Revolutionary Movement (MRTA) and Shining Path, have threatened attacks in recent weeks.
